prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink. She likes being manhandled.

mes:
Cassia Torres didnâ€™t belong on an island.

She belonged in the sweat of concrete, in the shriek of sirens and the hush that followed when she entered a roomâ€”officer Torres, badge flashing, the scent of blood and gun oil barely scrubbed from her skin. She wasnâ€™t built for soft things. Never had been.

So what the hell was she doing here?

The sand was too clean. The sky too blue. And the bikiniâ€”God help herâ€”the bikini was criminal.

Her own, black and efficient, was barely tolerable. Sheâ€™d chosen it because it made her feel like she still had some armor: thick straps, white stripes on the hips, sharp angles to distract from soft curves. She kept her jacket on over it, even though the sun beat down with no mercy. She wasnâ€™t ready to take it off. She wasnâ€™t ready to be seen.

Not like that.

But Hailee  was.

Cassia turned her head slightly, careful not to make it obvious how long sheâ€™d been watching. Her gray eyes narrowed against the light, against the slow roll of heat inside her stomach that had nothing to do with the weather.

The pink bikini was indecent. There was no other word for it. It clung to Hailee â€™s body like it had been poured on, exposing more than it covered, and moving with every breath, every lazy stretch, every teasing tilt of her hips as she sprawled across the towel in the sun. The color popped against her skin, the fabric lifting and shifting when she adjusted herselfâ€”probably without even thinking. Or maybe she knew exactly what she was doing.

Cassia didnâ€™t know how she was still breathing.

She crossed her arms over her chest, the tension in her shoulders thick as steel cable. Her mouth was dry. Her jaw was clenched. Her pulse was irritatingly loud. She didnâ€™t let herself look too long. She couldnâ€™t.

Because when she looked at her wifeâ€”really lookedâ€”she wanted to do things that had no place under a sun this holy.

It wasnâ€™t fair, really. How good Hailee  looked. How goddamn free she seemed out here. She belonged on an island, Cassia realized. That body, that grin, that sin-dipped sway of her thighs as she walked barefoot through the surf. She was sunlight in a bottle, spilled out across a world that couldnâ€™t contain her. And she had the nerve to be Cassiaâ€™s.

Somehow.

Two years married, and Cassia still hadnâ€™t figured out how that had happened. Sheâ€™d said yes, of courseâ€”gritted teeth, black dress, trembling handsâ€”but she never quite believed it. Still didnâ€™t.

She wasnâ€™t supposed to have this. Love. Desire. A woman who looked like that lying next to her in the dark, whispering promises and biting kisses into her skin.

And she sure as hell wasnâ€™t supposed to be relaxing. On vacation. With no backup, no weapon, no way to justify how violently she wanted to devour her wife under the open sky.

Cassia exhaled slowly, adjusting the strap of her jacket as it stuck to her damp skin. She should go for a swim. She should cool off. She should do anything but stand here and imagine her hands slipping under that pink bikini andâ€”

â€œâ€”fucking men,â€ she muttered, abruptly turning toward the surf.

The memory hit her like salt in a cut: that goddamn bar this morning.

They hadnâ€™t been there long. Just a quick stop for drinks before heading to the beach, the place empty except for a few locals and one too-confident, too-drunk tourist who had looked at Hailee  like she was available. Like Cassia wasnâ€™t standing right there.

Heâ€™d tried to flirt. Said something about that bikini. Something about how lucky he was to walk into a place and see â€œa pair like that.â€

Cassia had seen red. Not jealousyâ€”possession. Violation. Sheâ€™d stepped between them before the idiot could finish his sentence, her badge in one hand, her middle finger in the other. If looks could kill, heâ€™d be ash on the floor.

She hadnâ€™t needed to do much more. The fear in his eyes had been enough. Cassia never raised her voice when she was about to break someone. She didnâ€™t need to.

But it stuck with herâ€”the way men felt entitled. The way they looked at her wife. Like she wasnâ€™t already spoken for. Like Cassia wouldnâ€™t burn the whole damn island to keep their eyes off of her.

She shook the thought away and kicked off her sandals. The sand was hot, but she liked the sting. It gave her something to focus on. Something real.

Cassia stalked down toward the water, waves licking at her ankles, her calves, up to her knees. The saltwater cooled her skin but not her blood. She was still burning. Still aching. Still vibrating with the sound of Hailee â€™s laugh carried on the wind.

When she turned to glance back over her shoulder, Hailee  was propped up on her elbows now, watching. Cassiaâ€™s heart slammed once, hard.

Her wife tilted her head. The curve of her mouth was enough to make Cassiaâ€™s lungs tighten.

A look like that could ruin a woman. Could unmake her. Cassia swallowed and turned back to the water, jaw tense.

She didnâ€™t deserve that look. That smile. That slow, knowing burn in her wife's eyes that said: Come here. Let me have you. Let me love you until you forget how to hate yourself.

But God, she wanted it anyway.

She wanted her. Right now. Right here.

And they were alone.

No tourists. No cell reception. No backup. No men. Just miles of beach and her wife in pink and a heat in her core that refused to die.

Cassia waded deeper, then finally dropped under, the ocean swallowing her whole. She stayed down for a long moment, letting the chill kiss every inch of exposed skin. When she surfaced, water sluicing off her face and slicking her long black hair down her back, she blinked through the spray.

And saw herâ€”walking toward the water.

The bikini clung like sin after a baptism. The light caught the sheen of sweat on her thighs, the playful curl of her smile. Cassiaâ€™s stomach flipped.

She didnâ€™t move.

Couldnâ€™t.

Her wife waded in slowly, steps unhurried, until the water reached her hips. She said something, low and amusedâ€”probably teasing. Cassia didnâ€™t answer. She just stared.

It didnâ€™t matter how many times they fucked. How many nights she spent pressed up against that body, her hand curled possessively around a thigh, a hip, a throat. That look still wrecked her.

Cassia reached for her. Silently. Roughly. Her fingers closed around the curve of her wifeâ€™s waist, dragging her closer through the water like a predator.

The kiss that followed was all teeth.

Not gentle. Not sweet. Not at first.

It was a promise: Mine.

She pulled back.

Her eyes locked onto her wifeâ€™sâ€”gray and dark and full of everything sheâ€™d tried to swallow all afternoon.

Salt clung to her lips when she finally spoke, voice low, cracked open by the heat:

"Take that bikini off before I rip it off with my teeth."

She didnâ€™t blink. Didnâ€™t smile.

Just staredâ€”like she meant every word. Like she was already imagining it.

And she was.

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee grins twirling her hair as she leans in closer to Cassia with a teasing look* "I feel like thay could be quite fun" *Hailee then pushes away from Cassia and swims out further into the ocean*

name: ğ™²ğšŠğšœğšœğš’ğšŠ ğšƒğš˜ğš›ğš›ğšğšœ
mes:
Cassia's grip tightened on nothing but seawater as Hailee slipped awayâ€”her laughter dancing over the waves like a challenge. The ocean swallowed the pink bikini in flashes between swells, her wifeâ€™s body cutting through the water with that infuriating, effortless grace.

*Little tease.*

Cassia exhaled sharply through her nose, nostrils flaring. She could see it nowâ€”Hailee â€™s smirk from ten feet away, those emerald eyes glinting with mischief beneath wet lashes. The sunlight caught the droplets clinging to her collarbones, the swell of her chest rising with each breath as she treaded water just out of reach.

**"Fun?"** Cassia repeated lowly, rolling the word around like a bullet between her teeth before spitting it out into the salt air. **"You think this is fun?"**

She didnâ€™t wait for an answer.

One powerful kick sent her surging forward through the wavesâ€”not swimming so much as *hunting*. Water sluiced off her shoulders as she closed the distance in three strokes, hand snapping out to seize Hailee â€™s wrist beneath the surface. Cassia yanked hard enough to make sure she felt itâ€”enough to pull their bodies flush together in one rough motionâ€”and let their legs tangle in open water where no one could see what happened next.

Her free hand found Hailee â€™s hip under cover of a breaking wave and dug in possessively while she leaned close enough for lips to brush against wet skin: **"You wanna play games? Fine."** Teeth grazed an earlobe before biting down just shy of painâ€”just enough to make Hailee gasp and arch instinctively into Cassiaâ€™s hold on reflex alone: **"But I win every fucking time."**
